page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY:WOODTON AREA
page.content: These parishes have Saxon settlement names:Woodton,in a wood;Brooke,near a stream;Kirstead,near a church & Seething,of Sip(a)'s people. Woodton's claim to fame is Admiral Lord Nelson,whose mother was Catherine Suckling.His grandfather Maurice, rector of Woodton,was brother to Robert,Lord of Woodton Manor,so Nelson spent many school holidays at Woodton. In 1905,commemorating the connection,a Parish room was built;the foundation stone laid by Earl Nelson on Trafalgar Day.Seething achieved its place in history when the airfield built there 1942-3 became the operational HQ for the 8th USAF 448th Bomb Group,whose B24 Liberators flew 262 missions. Though sold in 1959,with most runways broken up for road-building & the land returned to farming,there is still enough for the Waveney Flying Club.
